summary: This bill, the African Burial Ground International Memorial Museum and Educational Center Study Act, directs the Secretary of the Interior to study the feasibility of establishing a museum and educational center at the African Burial Ground National Monument in New York City. The study will assess the suitability of a museum dedicated to the enslaved, examine African cultural traditions, explore the history of slavery, and encourage collaboration with other institutions. The Secretary must submit a report with findings and recommendations within three years.
